results.name: Trajectory of 1 under the morphism 1 -> {1,1,2,1}, 2 -> {2}.
comment: It can be shown that this is lim_{t -> oo} S_t, where S_0 = 1, S_{t+1} = S_t S_t 2 S_t.
Suggested by A131989: a(n) = length of n-th run of 1's in A131989.
For a proof of this see the Comments of A131989. - _Michel Dekking_, Oct 19 2019
link: Seiichi Manyama, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Index entries for sequences that are fixed points of mappings
formula: Denote the sequence by a(1), a(2), ...
Block t, that is, S_t, extends from n=1 through n=(3^(t+1)-1)/2.
Given n, to find a(n): first find t from
Then if n=3^t, a(n) = 2. Otherwise, a(n) = a(n'), where
n' = n-p if n<3^t, otherwise n' = n-2p-1.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Oct 09 2007, Oct 10 2007
